ygData.subject: Re: Multi-Objective NEAT
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Willem, unfortunately I don t know of a test suite for multiobjective control or classification problems.  There are however works that do apply

Hi Willem, unfortunately I don't know of a test suite for multiobjective =
control or classification problems.  There are however works that do apply =
multiobjective optimization to neuroevolution.  For example it has been use=
d in recent years in combination with novelty search (i.e. where novelty is=
 one of the "objectives").  But I don't know about a general such test-suit=
e.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "willemvanwilligen" <willemvanwillige=
n@...> wrote:
>
> Hi All,
> 
> I'm working on a multi-objective version of =
NEAT, that I tested on my own problem, but I was wondering if there are any=
 good test suites for this purpose. Of course, there are many test suites f=
or multi-objective function approximation, but these are not suitable for s=
olving with neural nets. So I need multiobjective control / classification =
problems.  
> 
> Any suggestions are welcome!
> 
> Best,
> Willem
>
